alert.note: Alert for Cooke; Denton; Wise (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 2:01PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Cooke, Denton and Wise Counties. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated, particularly within Spring Creek, Clear Creek, Flat Creek, Williams Creek, and Duck Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Denton, Sanger, Valley View, Prairie Point, Leo, Era, Hood, Lois, Slidell, Bolivar, Rosston and Greenwood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
